thread.title: Curtis Stigers - One More for the Road review: 'hip knowingness and old-school panache'
thread.title_full: Curtis Stigers - One More for the Road review: 'hip knowingness and old-school panache'

author: Jane Cornwell
title: Curtis Stigers - One More for the Road review: 'hip knowingness and old-school panache'
text:
Curtis Stigers - One More for the Road review: 'hip knowingness and old-school panache' 4 Friday 6 January 2017 15:26 BST New album: Curtis Stigers has released One More for the Road 
A suave start to the new year from the evergreen Stigers, whose luxurious voice glides through these 10 Sinatra covers with a combo of hip knowingness and old-school panache. 
Recorded live with the Danish Radio Big Band, who give the arrangements the requisite spirit and swing, it’s a salute to the iconic 1966 album Sinatra at the Sands that Ol’ Blue Eyes made in Vegas with the Count Basie Orchestra, but still feels very much Stigers’ own. 
The former rock star turned jazz idol has the confidence and emotional range to give the likes of Come Fly With Me the life it deserves, and Summer Wind has never sounded so 21st-century sexy. 
(Concord)
